description: A 10mm Auto and .40 S&W pocket pistol, the Id10 is a powerful little gun but difficult to control, specially when loaded with 10mm rounds. Uses 6-round magazines.

This is the largest and heaviest "minigun" ever made by Omnicorp. A 10mm Auto and .40 S&W variant of the N9A1 Chaingun that needs no electricity to propel rounds or rotate its barrels, with the same unique trigger group and very flexible burst limiter. Each setting in its fire selector lever can be further tuned through short or long trigger pulls.

This is a bullpup 10mm Auto and .40 S&W carbine with a match grade barrel, designed to emulate the performance of the classic M1 Carbine using ammunition more easily found today than old .30 car rounds. Unlike the M1, it is select fire capable with controlled 3 round bursts.

A semi automatic variant of the YM14 Carbine PDW, this also is a bullpup 10mm Auto and .40 S&W carbine with a match grade barrel, designed to emulate the performance of the classic M1 Carbine using ammunition more easily found today than old .30 car rounds.
